title: Billie Eilish’s 2025 “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour”: How To Get Tickets
description: The pop star will keep the "Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour" going with 23 additional arena dates this fall. Learn how to get tickets and what else you need to know. Billie Eilish’s 2025 “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour”: How To Get Tickets Paolo Ragusa
author: Paolo Ragusa
excerpt: Billie Eilish has announced a 2025 North American leg of her "Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour." Learn how to get tickets and everything else you need to know.

Billie Eilish is currently touring in support of her critically acclaimed third studio album Hit Me Hard and Soft, with newly-announced fall 2025 North American tour dates. After completing her successful international shows spanning North America, Australia, and Europe, Eilish has added 23 additional arena dates, including two nights in Tokyo, Japan, followed by an extensive second US leg. The tour, which began in September 2024, will now conclude on November 23, 2025, at San Francisco’s Chase Center — more than a year after it first kicked off.

Find our ticket buying guide, including the full list of dates, and everything else you need to know about her 2025 “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour” below.

Billie Eilish Tickets: Limited Availability

Tickets to Billie Eilish’s 2025 “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour” are NOW ON SALE. Initial pre-sale and the general on-sale have concluded, with tickets for a majority of the dates quickly selling out, according to publicly available Ticketmaster seating maps. Fans who missed out can now find tickets through Ticketmaster’s Face Value Exchange, which allows ticket holders who can no longer attend a show to resell their tickets to other fans at the original price.

Where to Purchase Lorde Tickets

  • Ticketmaster’s Face Vale Resale

Note: If you’re planning a trip to see Billie Eilish, you can save 15% off travel and accommodations through Booking.com.

Billie Eilish’s Anti-Scalping Measures for the “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour”

To protect fans from scalpers and ensure tickets remain at face value, Billie Eilish is utilizing Ticketmaster’s Face Value Exchange for all U.S. and Canada shows. This system allows fans who purchase tickets and cannot attend a show to resell them to other fans at the original price paid. To further protect against scalping, all tickets will be mobile-only and non-transferable (except in New York where resale cannot legally be restricted).

What to Expect at Billie Eilish’s “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour”

The “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour” has received rave reviews from critics and fans alike. Concertgoers can expect to hear tracks from Eilish’s critically acclaimed third studio album Hit Me Hard and Soft, which was released in May 2024, along with fan favorites from her previous work. The Grammy-nominated hit “Birds of a Feather” has become a standout moment in the show, now the most streamed song on Spotify by a female artist in the last decade.

Eilish’s performances showcase her versatility as a musician, with her playing multiple instruments throughout the show including piano, acoustic guitar, and electric guitar alongside her brother and collaborator, FINNEAS. The production features innovative staging, stunning visuals, and the intimate connection with the audience that has become a hallmark of her live shows.

Billie Eilish’s Sustainability Initiatives

The “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour” features numerous sustainability efforts, continuing Eilish’s long-standing partnership with environmental nonprofit REVERB. These initiatives include:

  • A portion of ticket proceeds from North American shows going to REVERB and other organizations addressing food insecurity and climate crisis
  • Reduction of greenhouse gas pollution
  • Decreasing single-use plastic waste
  • Supporting climate action
  • Plant-based food options in partnership with Support+Feed
  • Free water refill stations at every venue (bring an empty reusable water bottle or donate to receive a custom RockNRefill Nalgene bottle)
  • Eco-Villages set up at two locations in the main concourse of every show where fans can take part in sustainability efforts

Frequently Asked Questions About Billie Eilish’s “Hit Me Hard and Soft Tour”

How much are tickets for Billie Eilish’s 2025 tour? Ticket prices vary by venue, city, and seating section. Check Ticketmaster for specific pricing details for each show.

Will there be VIP packages available? Check with Ticketmaster when purchasing tickets for any available premium experience or VIP package options.

What time do doors open for Billie Eilish concerts? Doors typically open 90 minutes to 2 hours before showtime. Check your specific venue for exact timing.

How long is a Billie Eilish concert? Billie Eilish typically performs for approximately 90-120 minutes.

Are there opening acts for Billie Eilish’s tour? Previous legs of the tour have featured supporting acts including Towa Bird, The Marías, Ashnikko, Tom Odell, and Nat & Alex Wolff. Support acts for the newly announced dates have not yet been confirmed.

What is the age requirement for Billie Eilish concerts? Age requirements vary by venue. Check with your specific venue for details.

Does Billie Eilish play the same setlist at every show? While there is a core setlist, Eilish has been known to change songs and add special moments unique to certain dates, including surprise covers and guest appearances (she recently covered Radiohead’s “Creep” in Amsterdam, for instance).

What sustainability measures are in place? Billie Eilish has implemented numerous environmental initiatives in partnership with REVERB, including reduced plastic waste, plant-based food options, and portions of ticket sales supporting environmental causes.

What else should I know about attending a Billie Eilish concert?

  • Tickets are mobile-only and non-transferable (except in New York)
  • Bring an empty reusable water bottle to use at free refill stations
  • Consider taking public transportation or carpooling to reduce carbon footprint
  • Eilish encourages fans to wear thrifted, upcycled, or borrowed clothing instead of buying new
